location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.190 of 1850 from Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter encloses a translation of correspondence sent by the Native Agent at Sharjah Moollah Hussein [MullƒÅ Husayn], reporting on the unsuccessful siege of Suhar by the Sultan of Muscat, during which thirty men were wounded or killed. The Sharjah agent's letter contains further reports of skirmishes between the Trucial Coast sheikhs and tribes, and the imprisonment of Sheikh Syed Humood ben Azan [Said Hamood bin Azan] of Sohar [Suhar] by the Sultan of Muscat, after Azan's men destroyed the houses and bazaar surrounding the Imam's fort at Ghullah.
